messages.title: Sorry we missed you
messages.content: I am sorry I missed you. The Labour Party team called at your home to hear your views on Exeter and the country’s future. I hope I can count on your support.

messages.title: How Labour will help people in Exeter
messages.content: If Labour win in 2015. A Labour Government will: - Raise the Minimum Wage to at least £8 an hour by the end of the next Parliament. - Introduce a new 10p starting rate of tax for lower and middle earners with a new Lower 10p starting rate. - Cut tax for 24 million people - Invest an extra £2.5 billion from a tax on the tobacco companies to help small business with business rate relief. - Increase personal tax allowance for working parents of 3 and 4 year olds. - Require all teachers to be properly qualified. - Introduce a lower energy tariff for the elderly. - Cap rents for working people in private rented accommodation and legislate for three year tenancies. - Freeze energy prices until 2017 and reform the energy market so it. - Expand free childcare for working parents of 3 and 4 year olds to 25 hours a week. Cut and then freeze business rates to help small and medium.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Raise the Minimum Wage to at least £8 an hour by the end of the next Parliament.
Introduce a new 10p starting rate of tax for lower and middle earners and cut tax for 24 million people.
Invest an extra £2.5 billion from a tax on the tobacco companies to help small business with business rate relief.
Require all teachers to be properly qualified.
Introduce a lower energy tariff for the elderly and freeze energy prices until 2017.
Cap rents for working people in private rented accommodation and legislate for three year tenancies.
Expand free childcare for working parents of 3 and 4 year olds to 25 hours a week.
Cut and then freeze business rates to help small and medium businesses.

issues.economy: Invest an extra £2.5 billion from a tax on the tobacco companies to help small business with business rate relief.
issues.education: Require all teachers to be properly qualified.

housing.content: Cap rents for working people in private rented accommodation and legislate for three year tenancies.

leaflet.personalStatement: I am sorry I missed you. The Labour Party team called at your home to hear your views on Exeter and the country’s future. I hope I can count on your support.

images.caption: Photos on the leaflet featuring Ben Bradshaw and other Labour Party members.
